wordpressWpcContributors.bio:
People like to say hi to me.

I have been developing for the web for a very long time, and using WordPress since it was in beta. I currently love to code bleeding edge technology which includes using JavaScript frameworks like React and Angular.

People like to say hi to me.

content.raw: I have been using WordPress since the early days. Nowadays I'm a senior software developer that specializes in WordPress at Disney. I'm also socially awkward, but love when people say hi to me.

content.raw: The talk will focus towards non-developers, and use no code, but will explain a very developer-focused tool / addition to WordPress. Takeaways will include understanding of what the API is on a high-level, and also what it can be used to create.

node.title: The Case for the WordPress REST API

author.bio:
People like to say hi to me.

I have been developing for the web for a very long time, and using WordPress since it was in beta. I currently love to code bleeding edge technology which includes using JavaScript frameworks like React and Angular.

content.raw: Roy Sivan is a WordPress developer and has been using WordPress since version 0.7. He has worked all over the place, but currently works for Disney writing code for WordPress and other web applications.
content.rendered: Roy Sivan is a WordPress developer and has been using WordPress since version 0.7. He has worked all over the place, but currently works for Disney writing code for WordPress and other web applications.

content.raw:
JavaScript is a powerful language that you can use to do simple UI things like animation to building complex multi view single page applications. I want to focus on a small piece of functionality that you may need built. Whether it is a complex form, a UI piece to help with engagement, or something else that is highly interactive and you want to increase UI/UX while still interacting with the WordPress database.

I will walk through using JavaScript, specifically AngularJS to build a small web application that you can use anywhere on your site. I will walk through step by step an example application, and show you how to leverage the data in WordPress to create a highly interactive piece of functionality for your website.
